Package moulton.scalable.texts

Class TextHistory

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.texts.TextHistory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScrollableComponent
public class TextHistory
extends MenuComponent
implements ScrollableComponent
A menu component that holds a history of text. A scroll bar can be added to see more than is able to be shown in the specified rectangle. Even if no scroll bar is added, the text history is still functional, just static. The scroll bar should be saved as bar. New lines can be added by use of addToList(String...).

A couple of optional features specific to text history include:

  • addToTop defines the view mode, or in other words, whether most recent messages should be displayed at the top or the bottom.
  • maxMessages limits how many messages the text history can hold at a time. If more are added, older lines are deleted.
  • textDemarkation decides whether each entry should be separated by a separating line similar to an outline.
  • wordSplitting defines whether words can be split on ends of lines, or whether lines can only split on break characters.

Although it is highly recommended to add entries to the text history by the provided method, if the list needs to be accessed directly by a subclass, history is where the entries are internally saved.

Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Details

    • history

      protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> history
      The list of the strings being held.

    • width

      protected java.lang.String width
      The dimensions of the rectangle.

    • height

      protected java.lang.String height
      The dimensions of the rectangle.

    • font

      protected java.awt.Font font
      The font that the history should be drawn in.

    • bar

      protected ScrollBar bar
      The scroll bar to change which strings are displayed.
      See Also:
      setScrollBar(ScrollBar)

    • addToTop

      protected boolean addToTop
      Whether or not the text history should add new strings to the top or bottom of the list. This correlates with NOT ScrollBar.inverseRender.
      See Also:
      setViewMode(boolean)

    • maxMessages

      protected int maxMessages
      The maximum number of messages saved. After this number is reached, the oldest message is deleted once the newest one is saved.
      See Also:
      setMaxMessages(int), getMaxMessages()

    • wordSplitting

      protected boolean wordSplitting
      Whether word splitting is allowed for end of lines. In other words, whether in rendering the text history, encountering and end of line will force previous characters (until a break) to the next line. Break characters include space, new line, and hyphens. Defaults to false.
      See Also:
      getWordSplitting(), setWordSplitting(boolean)

    • textDemarkation

      protected boolean textDemarkation
      Whether each text displayed should be separated from other texts by a black line. Defaults to false.
      See Also:
      setTextDemarkation(boolean), getTextDemarkation()

    • outline

      protected boolean outline
      Whether or not this component should render a black outline on the border of the component.
      See Also:
      setOutline(boolean), getOutline()

    • textColor

      protected java.awt.Color textColor
      The color with which the messages in history are printed.
      See Also:
      setTextColor(Color)

    • scrollCoords

      protected int[][] scrollCoords
      Saved scroll coordinates found from most recent render.
      See Also:
      getActiveScrollCoordinates()

  • Constructor Details

    • TextHistory

      public TextHistory​(Panel parent, int x, int y, java.awt.Font font, boolean addToTop, int maxMessages)
      Creates a new TextHistory component and adds it to the parent panel by MenuComponent(Panel, int, int).
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent panel that this component will reside on
      x - the x-component this is in the parent's grid
      y - the y-component this is in the parent's grid
      font - the font that will display the different messages in history
      addToTop - whether messages should be added and displayed top-down or bottom-up (addToTop)
      maxMessages - the maximum number of messages that this will hold at a time (maxMessages)

    • TextHistory

      public TextHistory​(Panel parent, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, java.lang.String w, java.lang.String h, java.awt.Font font, boolean addToTop, int maxMessages)
      Creates a new TextHistory component and adds it to the parent panel by MenuComponent(Panel, String, String).
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent panel that this component will reside on
      x - the string expression determining the x-position of this component on the parent panel
      y - the string expression determining the y-position of this component on the parent panel
      w - the string expression determining the component's width
      h - the string expression determining the component's height
      font - the font that will display the different messages in history
      addToTop - whether messages should be added and displayed top-down or bottom-up (addToTop)
      maxMessages - the maximum number of messages that this will hold at a time (maxMessages)

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g, int xx, int yy, int ww, int hh)
      Description copied from class: MenuComponent
      Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
      Specified by:
      render in class MenuComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
      hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

    • addToList

      public void addToList​(java.lang.String... s)

      Parameters:
      s - The string(s) that should be added.

    • setScrollBar

      public void setScrollBar​(ScrollBar bar)
      Sets the scroll bar so the text history can show more than just recent messages.
      Will also call forceScrollBarMatch() to coincide with addToTop.
      Parameters:
      bar - the scroll bar to replace bar.

    • setViewMode

      public void setViewMode​(boolean recentAtTop)
      Sets whether this text history should display most recent additions at the top (true) or the bottom (false)
      Parameters:
      recentAtTop - value to be saved as addToTop

    • forceScrollBarMatch

      protected void forceScrollBarMatch()
      Two attributes of the text history must match the scroll bar's analogous attributes for rendering and scrolling to operate correctly. Thus, whenever the bar or addToTop is altered, the effect must occur in the connected scroll bar.

    • setMaxMessages

      public void setMaxMessages​(int maxMessages)
      Sets the maximum number of messages that this text history will hold.
      Parameters:
      maxMessages - maxMessages

    • getActiveScrollCoordinates

      public int[][] getActiveScrollCoordinates()
      Specified by:
      getActiveScrollCoordinates in interface ScrollableComponent
      Returns:
      where a mouse scrolling action should affect this component. Normally just its rendering or clicking boundaries. int[0] should hold x points and int[1] should hold y points. The number of x and y points should be equal.
